channel.title: red on 1709 Brewing
channel.description: Recent content in red on 1709 Brewing

item.title: Fine Gael Irish Ale
item.author: jarret.lavallee@gmail.com (jarret)
item.description: In 2009 I did my first all grain. I went out and bought a turkey fryer and a home depot 5 gallon cooler. I made what I thought was a SS braid ( turned out to be some sort of plastic) and started a mash with it. To myÂ surprise, I was able to make it through the batch with out any trouble. I batch sparged, missed my numbers and ended up spilling some wort.

item.title: Red Rye
item.author: jarret.lavallee@gmail.com (jarret)
item.description: So I want to brew up a red rye with the hops that I have. Here is what I am thinking. UPDATE: I brewed this today (12/4/11) and it smells awesome. Mashed at 154 and ended up with 5.5 Gallons at 13 Brix. 7 lb. American 2-row 1 lb. American Munich 4 oz. CaraMunich 2 oz. Special B 1.5 lb. Flaked rye 1 lb. Rye malt 0.5 lb American crystal 120L

item.title: Red Headed Step Child
item.author: jarret.lavallee@gmail.com (jarret)
item.description: This is an Irish Red (Hence the horrible pun). I brewed it as the first brew through my Brutus 20! It went very well except for overflowing my Mash Tun… Oops. I hope it will be good. Irish Red Type: All Grain Date: 10/29/2011 Batch Size (fermenter): 5.50 gal Boil Size: 7.04 gal Boil Time: 60 min Equipment: Pot and Cooler ( 5 Gal/40 L) - All Grain End of Boil Volume 6.
